{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Ray Vega | image = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Ray Justin Vega{{cite web|url=http://repertoire.bmi.com/writer.asp?fromrow=151&torow=175&keyname=VEGA%20RAY%20JUSTIN&querytype=WriterID&keyid=355286&page=7&blnWriter=True&blnPublisher=True&blnArtist=True&affiliation=BMI&cae=200331741|title=Results for Ray Justin Vega|work=[[Broadcast Music Incorporated]]|accessdate=August 12, 2013}} | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|7|28}}{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|year=2008|page=439|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} | origin = Los Angeles, California, United States | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1986–present | label = [[BNA Records|BNA]]
[[Ariola Records|Ariola]] | associated_acts = The Vega Brothers | website = }} '''Ray Vega''' (born July 28, 1961) is an American [[country music|country]] and adult contemporary artist. In the 1980s, Vega performed with his brother, Robert, as The Vega Brothers. The duo were signed by [[MCA Records]] and their single "Heartache the Size of Texas" peaked at No. 54 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles]] chart in 1986. Their music was produced by [[Jimmy Bowen]]. After the duo broke up, Vega worked various odd jobs in Nashville.{{cite journal|date=December 6, 1996|title=New Artist Fact File|journal=[[Radio & Records]]|page=46|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-RandR/1990s/1996/R&R-1996-12-06.pdf}} Vega was signed to [[BNA Records]] as a solo artist in 1996. His debut single, "Remember When," peaked at No. 56 on the Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart. The song was produced by [[Josh Leo]].{{cite magazine|date=December 28, 1996|title=Talent to spare|magazine=Billboard|page=27|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=sQkEAAAAMBAJ&dq=%22ray+vega%22+%22remember+when%22&pg=PA27}} After the disappointing response to the single, release of Vega's debut album, also titled ''Remember When,'' was cancelled; promotional copies, however, did enter into the marketplace. Another single, "Even More," failed to chart in the United States, although it reached No. 57 on the ''[[RPM (magazine)|RPM]]'' Adult Contemporary chart in Canada. Vega later recorded a pop album, 1999's ''Geography,'' that was released in Germany via [[Bertelsmann Music Group|BMG]]. Additionally, country artist [[Dusty Drake]] recorded a composition of Vega's, entitled "And Then," and released it as his debut single in 2002. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Remember When'' | * Release date: October 8, 1996 * Label: [[BNA Records]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Geography'' | * Release date: May 31, 1999 * Label: [[Ariola Records]] |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Single ! colspan="3"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]] ! width="45"| [[RPM (magazine)|CAN Country]] ! width="45"| [[RPM (magazine)|CAN AC]] |- | 1996 ! scope="row"| "Remember When" | 56 | 94 | — | align="left" rowspan="3"| ''Remember When'' |- |rowspan=2|1997 ! scope="row"| "I Can Dream"{{cite journal|date=March 28, 1997|title=Going for Adds|journal=Radio & Records|page=56|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-RandR/1990s/1997/RR-1997-03-28.pdf}} | — | — | — |- ! scope="row"| "Even More"{{cite journal|date=November 14, 1997|title=A/C picks|journal=Gavin Report|page=19|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-Gavin-Report/90/97/Gavin-1997-11-14.pdf}} | — | — | 57 |- | colspan="6" style="font-size:8pt"| "—" denotes releases that did not chart |- |} ===Music videos=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" !
